item.title: Minnesota State High School Boys Hockey Predictions (Updated Quarterfinals)
item.description: In a previous post, I used Monte Carlo simulation to predict the winner of the 2018 Minnesota State High School Boys Hockey tournament. Now that the quarterfinal games have been played, I thought I would update my predictions. The process for this is to: Update the Elo ratings based on the quarterfinal games; Re-simulate the tournament I simulated the Class A state tournament 10,000 times using the same process as described in my previous post.

item.title: Minnesota State High School Boys Hockey Predictions
item.description: The state high school boys hockey tournament, scheduled for March 7â€“10, is one of the premiere sporting events in the state of Minnesota. According to Wikipedia, this event has drawn over 100,000 spectators 22 times in its history, eclipsing 135,000 spectoators in 2015. Many national caliber players played high school hockey in Minnesota, several taking part in the state tournament. Names like Neal Broten, Herb Brooks, and T. J. Oshie are alumni of state tournaments past.
